title: 109_hr611
content: The Act titled "Haiti Economic and Infrastructure Reconstruction Act" establishes an Economic and Infrastructure Reconstruction Program for the Republic of Haiti. The President is authorized to establish the Haiti Economic and Infrastructure Reconstruction Program for Haiti, deploying individuals to assist with economic and infrastructure development. The Director of the Program will be appointed from the Bureau for Latin America and the Caribbean of the United States Agency for International Development. The Director of the Haiti Economic and Infrastructure Reconstruction Program will coordinate with the Government of Haiti to provide assistance in various sectors such as economy, education, judiciary, healthcare, and infrastructure development. The Director of the Haiti Economic and Infrastructure Reconstruction Program will recruit individuals with specific qualifications, including a college degree or relevant skills, and prioritize the recruitment of Haitian-Americans. Funds will be used to cover housing costs for the Reconstruction Program. The Reconstruction Program covers housing costs and salaries for individuals deployed to Haiti for up to one year, with the possibility of extension if deemed appropriate by the Director. The Director may extend an individual's deployment for up to two additional years if consented. Reports on the Reconstruction Program must be submitted to Congress at six months, twelve months, and eighteen months after the Act's enactment, detailing relevant information. The curr_chunk provides information on the recruitment process for the Reconstruction Program, including selection criteria, incentives offered, number of individuals recruited, placement locations, and potential expansion. The term "infrastructure" is defined as roads, highways, bridges, tunnels, airports, mass transportation systems, and intermodal facilities. The curr_chunk discusses the authorization of appropriations for various infrastructure projects such as transportation systems, water treatment facilities, waste disposal facilities, and utilities. Congress recommends allocating at least $3,000,000 for each fiscal year from 2006 to 2011 for this purpose. The curr_chunk discusses the establishment of a healthcare assistance program for Haiti. The President is authorized to establish the "Haiti Healthcare Assistance Program" for grants to qualified nongovernmental organizations in Haiti for infectious disease prevention. Coordination with various entities is required, and grant funds must be used appropriately. The "Haiti Healthcare Assistance Program" grants aim to combat infectious diseases in Haiti by establishing a comprehensive healthcare infrastructure focusing on education, prevention, care, treatment, and capacity development. The Administrator of the United States Agency for International Development will set criteria for nongovernmental organizations to qualify. Healthcare infrastructure includes hospitals, clinics, medical facilities, and programs. Authorization of Appropriations.--Such sums as may be necessary are authorized to be appropriated for the Haiti Healthcare Assistance Program for fiscal years 2006 through 2011, with a minimum of $3,000,000 allocated each year.
